info.description: The Recruiting service enables applications to access Workday data about recruiting, such as job postings, prospects, and interviews.
info.title: recruiting

tags.name: prospects
tags.description: Provides the ability to retrieve and create prospect data.

tags.name: Prompt Values
tags.description: Retrieves instances that can be used as values for other endpoint parameters in this service.

get.summary: Retrieves a single experience instance for a ~prospect~.
get.description:
Retrieves the work experience with the specified ID for the specified ~prospect~.

Secured by: Prospects

Scope: Recruiting, Talent Pipeline

parameters.name: ID
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the resource.

parameters.name: subresourceID
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the subresource.

200.description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched data.

400.description: Invalid request. (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages)

get.description: Retrieves instances that can be used as values for other endpoint parameters in this service.

200.description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched data.

get.description:
Secured by: Job Postings: External

Scope: Recruiting

parameters.name: category
parameters.description: The job family group for the job posting, according to the job requisition.

parameters.name: jobSite
parameters.description: The job posting site that the job is posted on.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of objects in a single response. The default is 20. The maximum is 100.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The zero-based index of the first object in a response collection. The default is 0. Use offset with the limit parameter to control paging of a response collection. Example: If limit is 5 and offset is 9, the response returns a collection of 5 objects starting with the 10th object.

200.description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched data.

400.description: Invalid request. (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages)

post.description:
Creates a single ~prospect~ instance with the specified data. In the request body, specify at least the required field: candidate.name.country.id. The Recruiting Name Components configuration might require additional fields for candidate.name. To determine additional required fields, see the Recruiting Name Components tab on the Maintain Name Components by ~Country~ task.

Secured by: Create External Prospects, Set Up: External Career Site Access

Scope: Recruiting

400.description:
Invalid request. (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages)
Error Code | Validation Message
--- | ---
A278 | Enter active candidate pools.
A255 | Enter referral as the source when you enter referred by.
A821 | You can't specify a Phone Device Type that's Hidden for Recruiting.
A274 | Enter a valid format for Phone Number.
A269 | Enter an email address in this format: xxx@yy.com.
A823 | Specify a value for Country Phone Code.
A268 | Enter the referral for the prospect.
A820 | Specify a value for Phone Device Type.
A284 | Enter active candidate tags.
A822 | Specify a value for Phone Number.
A256 | Enter a name.
A249 | You must enter the prospect’s email address or phone number.
A673 | The Phone Device Type that you specified must be Active.
A288 | Enter a phone number in the valid format: [PhoneValidationMessage]

get.summary: Retrieves the education of a single ~prospect~ instance.
get.description:
Retrieves the education of the ~prospect~ with the specified ID.

Secured by: Prospects

Scope: Recruiting, Talent Pipeline

parameters.name: ID
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the resource.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of objects in a single response. The default is 20. The maximum is 100.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The zero-based index of the first object in a response collection. The default is 0. Use offset with the limit parameter to control paging of a response collection. Example: If limit is 5 and offset is 9, the response returns a collection of 5 objects starting with the 10th object.

200.description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched data.

400.description:
Invalid request. (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages)
Error Code | Validation Message
--- | ---
A283 | Enter a last year attended that is after the first year attended.
A261 | Enter a school name.

post.description:
To create a single instance, specify the single JSON object in the request body. To create multiple instances, specify "bulk=true" as a query parameter. You must specify the JSON object collection in data[ ] in the request body. The maximum collection size is 100.  In the request body, specify at least these required fields: schoolName.

Secured by: Create External Prospects

Scope: Recruiting

parameters.name: ID
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the resource.

400.description:
Invalid request. (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages)
Error Code | Validation Message
--- | ---
A283 | Enter a last year attended that is after the first year attended.
A261 | Enter a school name.

post.description:

You must specify the JSON object collection in data[ ] in the request body. The maximum collection size is 100.  In the request body, specify at least these required fields: companyName, title, startYear.

A240 | Enter end year when you enter the end month.
A258 | Enter a start year.
A282 | Enter a company name.
A271 | Enter an end month and end year that occur on or after the start month and start year.
A253 | Enter a number from 1 to 12 for end month.

post.description:
Submits interview details for the processing ~worker~ with the interviewer's rating and comment.

Secured by: Interview Feedback Public API

Scope: Recruiting

parameters.name: ID
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the resource.

400.description:
Invalid request. (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages)
Error Code | Validation Message
--- | ---
A129 | You cannot take action on this candidate.
A134 | Overall Comment is included but is hidden (Configure Optional Fields).  Please contact your administrator.
A130 | Select a valid rating.
A132 | Overall Comment Required (Configure Optional Fields) but not included.  Please contact your administrator.
A136 | Overall Rating is Required (Configure Optional Fields) but not included.  Please contact your administrator.
A131 | You cannot submit interview feedback because you are not a part of the interview team.
A133 | Overall Rating is included but is hidden (Configure Optional Fields).  Please contact your administrator.
A135 | Interview feedback task contains competencies, questionnaires, or both; complete feedback using Workday or the Give Interview Feedback URL provided by the API.

get.description:
Retrieves a collection of interviews.

Secured by: Interview Feedback Public API

Scope: Recruiting

parameters.name: interviewStatus
parameters.description:
"All applicable interview statuses for an Interview event. Statuses can be: 
 * AWAITING_ME - An in-progress Interview event is waiting for the logged-in user's feedback. 
 * COMPLETED - An Interview event is complete.
 * FEEDBACK_COMPLETE - All interview feedback for this in-progress event was submitted, but the Interview event isn’t awaiting the Make Interview Decision step.
 * NOT_SCHEDULED - An interview hasn't been scheduled for an in-progress Interview event.
 * PENDING_FEEDBACK - An in-progress Interview event is waiting for interviewer feedback.
 * SCHEDULED - An interview is scheduled for an in-progress Interview event.
 * SUBMITTED_FEEDBACK - The logged-in user submitted feedback for an in-progress Interview event.
 * MAKE_INTERVIEW_DECISION - The make an interview decision step for the candidate."

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of objects in a single response. The default is 20. The maximum is 100.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The zero-based index of the first object in a response collection. The default is 0. Use offset with the limit parameter to control paging of a response collection. Example: If limit is 5 and offset is 9, the response returns a collection of 5 objects starting with the 10th object.

200.description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched data.

400.description: Invalid request. (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages)

A242 | Enter only 1 ability type for the same language.

get.description:
Retrieves the ~prospect~ with the specified ID.

Secured by: Set Up: External Career Site Access, Prospects

Scope: Recruiting, Talent Pipeline

parameters.name: ID
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the resource.

200.description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched data.

400.description: Invalid request. (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages)

items.description: This object represents the possible facets for this resource

facetParameter.description: The alias used to select the facet

count.description: The number of instances returned by this facet

jobType.description: The ~worker~ sub-type for the job posting, according to the job requisition.

spotlightJob.description: True if the job posting is a ~Spotlight Job~ or not.

additionalLocations.description: The additional locations on the job posting, according to the job requisition.

company.description: The ~supervisory organization~ assigned to the job requisition associated with the job posting.

categories.description: The job family group for the job posting, according to the job requisition.

jobSite.description: The job posting site that the job is posted on.

endDate.description: The end date for the job posting.

url.example: Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, cum choro singulis consectetuer ut, ubique iisque contentiones ex duo. Quo lorem etiam eu.
url.description: External URL for Job Posting if it is posted to a published Workday External Career Site.

jobDescription.example: Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, cum choro singulis consectetuer ut, ubique iisque contentiones ex duo. Quo lorem etiam eu.
jobDescription.description: The description of the job for the job posting.

startDate.description: The start date for the job posting.

primaryLocation.description: The primary location for the job posting, according to the associated job requisition.

title.example: Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, cum choro singulis consectetuer ut, ubique iisque contentiones ex duo. Quo lorem etiam eu.
title.description: The title of the job posting, according to the associated job requisition.

timeType.description: The position time type for job posting.

interviewStatuses.description:
"All applicable interview statuses for an Interview event. Statuses can be: 
 * AWAITING_ME - An in-progress Interview event is waiting for the logged-in user's feedback. 
 * COMPLETED - An Interview event is complete.
 * FEEDBACK_COMPLETE - All interview feedback for this in-progress event was submitted, but the Interview event isn’t awaiting the Make Interview Decision step.
 * NOT_SCHEDULED - An interview hasn't been scheduled for an in-progress Interview event.
 * PENDING_FEEDBACK - An in-progress Interview event is waiting for interviewer feedback.
 * SCHEDULED - An interview is scheduled for an in-progress Interview event.
 * SUBMITTED_FEEDBACK - The logged-in user submitted feedback for an in-progress Interview event.
 * MAKE_INTERVIEW_DECISION - The make an interview decision step for the candidate."

hasCompetenciesQuestionnaires.description: If true, the interviewer feedback task awaiting processing has Competencies or Questionnaires with configured XIP settings.

giveInterviewFeedbackLink.example: Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, cum choro singulis consectetuer ut, ubique iisque contentiones ex duo. Quo lorem etiam eu.
giveInterviewFeedbackLink.description: A URL for the Give Interview Feedback task, for ~workers~ with access to the Interview Feedback Detail event awaiting processing.

jobRequisition.description: The job requisition the candidate applied to. Requires that the user is an interviewer for the in-progress Interview event or has access  to the Candidate Data: Interview Feedback Results domain.

jobApplication.description: The job application for the Recruiting event. Requires that the user is an interviewer for the in-progress Interview event or has access  to the Candidate Data: Interview Feedback Results domain.

overallRating.example: Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, cum choro singulis consectetuer ut, ubique iisque contentiones ex duo. Quo lorem etiam eu.
